Package org.ejbca.core.ejb.ra

Interface EndEntityManagementSession

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    EndEntityManagementSessionLocal, EndEntityManagementSessionRemote
    public interface EndEntityManagementSession
    Session bean handling end entity administration, i.e. adding and editing end entities.
    Version:
    $Id: EndEntityManagementSession.java 29540 2018-08-01 08:20:04Z jekaterina_b_helmes $

    • Method Detail

      • isAuthorizedToEndEntityProfile

        boolean isAuthorizedToEndEntityProfile​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                       int profileid,
                                       String rights)
        Check if user is authorized for specified an EE access rule for specified EEP.
        Parameters:
        admin - authenticationToken to be check for authorization
        profileid - id of EEP for which operation authorization needs to be checked
        rights - EE access rule to be checked (etc. AccessRulesConstants.DELETE_END_ENTITY...)
        Returns:
        true if user is authorized for specified EE access rules for specified EEP, false otherwise

      • addUser

        void addUser​(AuthenticationToken admin,
             String username,
             String password,
             String subjectdn,
             String subjectaltname,
             String email,
             boolean clearpwd,
             int endentityprofileid,
             int certificateprofileid,
             EndEntityType type,
             int tokentype,
             int hardwaretokenissuerid,
             int caid)
      throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
             EndEntityProfileValidationException,
             WaitingForApprovalException,
             CADoesntExistsException,
             EndEntityExistsException,
             CustomFieldException,
             IllegalNameException,
             ApprovalException,
             CertificateSerialNumberException
        Important: this method is old and shouldn't be used, use addUser(..EndEntityInformation...) instead.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        username - the unique user name.
        password - the password used for authentication.
        subjectdn - the DN the subject is given in his certificate.
        subjectaltname - the Subject Alternative Name to be used.
        email - the email of the subject or null.
        clearpwd - true if the password will be stored in clear form in the db, otherwise it is hashed.
        endentityprofileid - the id number of the end entity profile bound to this user.
        certificateprofileid - the id number of the certificate profile that should be generated for the user.
        type - of user i.e administrator, keyrecoverable and/or sendnotification, from SecConst.USER_XX.
        tokentype - the type of token to be generated, one of SecConst.TOKEN constants
        hardwaretokenissuerid - if token should be hard, the id of the hard token issuer, else 0.
        caid - the CA the user should be issued from.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - fail
        WaitingForApprovalException - fail
        CADoesntExistsException - if the caid of the user does not exist
        CertificateSerialNumberException - if SubjectDN serial number already exists.
        ApprovalException - if an approval already exists for this request.
        IllegalNameException - if the Subject DN failed constraints
        CustomFieldException - if the end entity was not validated by a locally defined field validator
        EndEntityExistsException - if an end entity by the specified username already exists

      • addUserFromWS

        void addUserFromWS​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                   EndEntityInformation userdata,
                   boolean clearpwd)
            throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                   EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                   EndEntityExistsException,
                   WaitingForApprovalException,
                   CADoesntExistsException,
                   CustomFieldException,
                   IllegalNameException,
                   ApprovalException,
                   CertificateSerialNumberException
        addUserFromWS is called from EjbcaWS if profile specifies merge data from profile to user we merge them before calling addUser
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator pwrforming the action
        userdata - a EndEntityInformation object, the fields status, timecreated and timemodified will not be used.
        clearpwd - true if the password will be stored in clear form in the db, otherwise it is hashed.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if administrator isn't authorized to add user
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - if data doesn't fulfill requirements of end entity profile
        EndEntityExistsException - if user already exists or some other database error occur during commit
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action have been added in the approval queue.
        CADoesntExistsException - if the caid of the user does not exist
        CustomFieldException - if the end entity was not validated by a locally defined field validator
        CertificateSerialNumberException - if SubjectDN serial number already exists.
        ApprovalException - if an approval already exists for this request.
        IllegalNameException - if the Subject DN failed constraints

      • addUser

        EndEntityInformation addUser​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                             EndEntityInformation userdata,
                             boolean clearpwd)
                      throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                             EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                             EndEntityExistsException,
                             WaitingForApprovalException,
                             CADoesntExistsException,
                             IllegalNameException,
                             CustomFieldException,
                             ApprovalException,
                             CertificateSerialNumberException
        Add a new user.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        userdata - a EndEntityInformation object, the fields status, timecreated and timemodified will not be used.
        clearpwd - true if the password will be stored in clear form in the db, otherwise it is hashed.
        Returns:
        returned object contains the same sensitive information as was passed in clearpwd, or an autogenerated pwd.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the administrator isn't authorized to add user
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - if data doesn't fulfill requirements of the end entity profile
        EndEntityExistsException - if user already exists or some other database error occurs during commit
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action has been added in the approval queue.
        CADoesntExistsException - fail
        IllegalNameException - if the Subject DN or SAN failed constraints
        CustomFieldException - if the end entity was not validated by a locally defined field validator
        ApprovalException - if an approval already exists for this request.
        CertificateSerialNumberException - if the CA requires that Subject DN Serial Numbers be unique, and the one specified here already exists.

      • addUserAfterApproval

        void addUserAfterApproval​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                          EndEntityInformation userdata,
                          boolean clearpwd,
                          AuthenticationToken lastApprovingAdmin)
                   throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                          EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                          EndEntityExistsException,
                          WaitingForApprovalException,
                          CADoesntExistsException,
                          CustomFieldException,
                          IllegalNameException,
                          ApprovalException,
                          CertificateSerialNumberException
        Add a new user after an AddEndEntityApprovalRequest had been approved.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        userdata - a EndEntityInformation object, the fields status, timecreated and timemodified will not be used.
        clearpwd - true if the password will be stored in clear form in the db, otherwise it is hashed.
        lastApprovingAdmin - The last administrator to have approved the request
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if administrator isn't authorized to add user
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - if data doesn't fulfill requirements of end entity profile
        EndEntityExistsException - if user already exists or some other database error occur during commit
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action have been added in the approval queue.
        WaitingForApprovalException - fail
        CADoesntExistsException - fail
        CustomFieldException - if the end entity was not validated by a locally defined field validator
        IllegalNameException - if the Subject DN failed constraints
        ApprovalException - if an approval already exists for this request.
        CertificateSerialNumberException - if SubjectDN serial number already exists.

      • changeUser

        void changeUser​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                EndEntityInformation userdata,
                boolean clearpwd)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                WaitingForApprovalException,
                CADoesntExistsException,
                ApprovalException,
                CertificateSerialNumberException,
                IllegalNameException,
                NoSuchEndEntityException,
                CustomFieldException
        Change user information.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        userdata - a EndEntityInformation object, timecreated and timemodified will not be used.
        clearpwd - true if the password will be stored in clear form in the db, otherwise it is hashed.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if administrator isn't authorized to add user
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - if data doesn't fullfil requirements of end entity profile
        ApprovalException - if an approval already is waiting for specified action
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action have been added in the approval queue.
        CADoesntExistsException - if the caid of the user does not exist
        IllegalNameException - if the Subject DN failed constraints
        CertificateSerialNumberException - if SubjectDN serial number already exists.
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if the end entity was not found
        CustomFieldException - if the end entity was not validated by a locally defined field validator

      • changeUser

        void changeUser​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                EndEntityInformation userdata,
                boolean clearpwd,
                boolean fromWebService)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                WaitingForApprovalException,
                CADoesntExistsException,
                ApprovalException,
                CertificateSerialNumberException,
                IllegalNameException,
                NoSuchEndEntityException,
                CustomFieldException
        Change user information.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        userdata - a EndEntityInformation object, timeCreated and timeModified will not be used.
        clearpwd - true if the password will be stored in clear form in the db, otherwise it is hashed.
        fromWebService - The service is called from webService
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if administrator isn't authorized to add user
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - if data doesn't fllfil requirements of end entity profile
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action have been added in the approval queue.
        CADoesntExistsException - if the caid of the user does not exist
        IllegalNameException - if the Subject DN failed constraints
        CertificateSerialNumberException - if SubjectDN serial number already exists.
        ApprovalException - if an approval already exists for this request.
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if the end entity was not found
        CustomFieldException - if the end entity was not validated by a locally defined field validator

      • changeUser

        void changeUser​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                EndEntityInformation userdata,
                boolean clearpwd,
                String newUsername)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                WaitingForApprovalException,
                CADoesntExistsException,
                ApprovalException,
                CertificateSerialNumberException,
                IllegalNameException,
                NoSuchEndEntityException,
                CustomFieldException
        Change user information.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        userdata - a EndEntityInformation object, timecreated and timemodified will not be used.
        clearpwd - true if the password will be stored in clear form in the db, otherwise it is hashed.
        newUsername - the new username of the end entity
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if administrator isn't authorized to add user
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - if data doesn't fullfil requirements of end entity profile
        ApprovalException - if an approval already is waiting for specified action
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action have been added in the approval queue.
        CADoesntExistsException - if the caid of the user does not exist
        IllegalNameException - if the Subject DN failed constraints
        CertificateSerialNumberException - if SubjectDN serial number already exists.
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if the end entity was not found
        CustomFieldException - if the end entity was not validated by a locally defined field validator

      • changeUserAfterApproval

        void changeUserAfterApproval​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                             EndEntityInformation userdata,
                             boolean clearpwd,
                             int approvalRequestId,
                             AuthenticationToken lastApprovingAdmin)
                      throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                             EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                             WaitingForApprovalException,
                             CADoesntExistsException,
                             ApprovalException,
                             CertificateSerialNumberException,
                             IllegalNameException,
                             NoSuchEndEntityException,
                             CustomFieldException
        Change user information after an EditEndEntityApprovalRequest has been approved
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        userdata - a EndEntityInformation object, timecreated and timemodified will not be used.
        clearpwd - true if the password will be stored in clear form in the db, otherwise it is hashed.
        approvalRequestId - the unique ID of the approval request (not the hash)
        lastApprovingAdmin - the last administrator to have approved the request
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if administrator isn't authorized to add user
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - if data doesn't fulfill requirements of end entity profile
        ApprovalException - if an approval already is waiting for specified action
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action have been added in the approval queue.
        CADoesntExistsException - if the caid of the user does not exist
        IllegalNameException - if the Subject DN failed constraints
        CertificateSerialNumberException - if SubjectDN serial number already exists.
        NoSuchEndEntityException - NoSuchEndEntityException if the user does not exist
        CustomFieldException - if the end entity was not validated by a locally defined field validator

      • changeUserAfterApproval

        void changeUserAfterApproval​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                             EndEntityInformation userdata,
                             boolean clearpwd,
                             int approvalRequestId,
                             AuthenticationToken lastApprovingAdmin,
                             String oldUsername)
                      throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                             EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                             WaitingForApprovalException,
                             CADoesntExistsException,
                             ApprovalException,
                             CertificateSerialNumberException,
                             IllegalNameException,
                             NoSuchEndEntityException,
                             CustomFieldException
        Change user information after an EditEndEntityApprovalRequest has been approved
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        userdata - a EndEntityInformation object, timecreated and timemodified will not be used.
        clearpwd - true if the password will be stored in clear form in the db, otherwise it is hashed.
        approvalRequestId - the unique ID of the approval request (not the hash)
        lastApprovingAdmin - the last administrator to have approved the request
        oldUsername - the username the end entity has prior to the name change
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if administrator isn't authorized to add user
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - if data doesn't fulfill requirements of end entity profile
        ApprovalException - if an approval already is waiting for specified action
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action have been added in the approval queue.
        CADoesntExistsException - if the caid of the user does not exist
        IllegalNameException - if the Subject DN failed constraints
        CertificateSerialNumberException - if SubjectDN serial number already exists.
        NoSuchEndEntityException - NoSuchEndEntityException if the user does not exist
        CustomFieldException - if the end entity was not validated by a locally defined field validator

      • deleteUser

        void deleteUser​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                String username)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                NoSuchEndEntityException,
                CouldNotRemoveEndEntityException
        Deletes a user from the database. The users certificates must be revoked BEFORE this method is called.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        username - the unique username.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if admin was not authorized to remove end entities
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if the user does not exist.
        CouldNotRemoveEndEntityException - if the user could not be deleted.

      • setUserStatus

        void setUserStatus​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                   String username,
                   int status)
            throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                   NoSuchEndEntityException,
                   ApprovalException,
                   WaitingForApprovalException
        Changes status of a user.
        Parameters:
        admin - An authentication token
        username - the unique username.
        status - the new status, from 'UserData'.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        NoSuchEndEntityException - fail
        ApprovalException - if an approval already is waiting for specified action
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action have been added in the approval queue.

      • setUserStatusAfterApproval

        void setUserStatusAfterApproval​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                String username,
                                int status,
                                int approvalRequestID,
                                AuthenticationToken lastApprovingAdmin)
                         throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                ApprovalException,
                                WaitingForApprovalException,
                                NoSuchEndEntityException
        Changes status of a user. This method is called mainly when executing a ChangeStatusEndEntityApprovalRequest
        Parameters:
        admin - An authentication token
        username - the unique username.
        status - the new status, from 'UserData'.
        approvalRequestID - The ID of the approval request submitted to change the status
        lastApprovingAdmin - the last administrator to have approved the request
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        ApprovalException - if an approval already is waiting for specified action
        WaitingForApprovalException - if approval is required and the action have been added in the approval queue.
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if the end entity was not found

      • setPassword

        void setPassword​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                 String username,
                 String password)
          throws EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                 AuthorizationDeniedException,
                 NoSuchEndEntityException
        Sets a new password for a user.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        username - the unique username.
        password - the new password for the user, NOT null.
        Throws:
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if the end entity was not found

      • setClearTextPassword

        void setClearTextPassword​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                          String username,
                          String password)
                   throws EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                          AuthorizationDeniedException,
                          NoSuchEndEntityException
        Sets a clear text password for a user.
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator pwrforming the action
        username - the unique username.
        password - the new password to be stored in clear text. Setting password to 'null' effectively deletes any previous clear text password.
        Throws:
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if the end entity was not found

      • verifyPassword

        boolean verifyPassword​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                       String username,
                       String password,
                       boolean decRemainingLoginAttemptsOnFailure)
                throws EndEntityProfileValidationException,
                       AuthorizationDeniedException,
                       NoSuchEndEntityException
        Verifies a password for a user, decreasing the remaining login attempts if verification fails and if caller wants (and it is not set to unlimited).
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        username - the unique username.
        password - the password to be verified.
        decRemainingLoginAttemptsOnFailure - if true and password verification fails, will try to decrease remaining login attempts (which can be unlimited)
        Returns:
        true if password was correct, false otherwise
        Throws:
        EndEntityProfileValidationException - fail
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if the end entity was not found

      • revokeAndDeleteUser

        void revokeAndDeleteUser​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                         String username,
                         int reason)
                  throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                         ApprovalException,
                         WaitingForApprovalException,
                         NoSuchEndEntityException,
                         CouldNotRemoveEndEntityException
        Revoke and then delete a user.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        username - user
        reason - reason
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        ApprovalException - if an approval already exists for this request.
        WaitingForApprovalException - fail
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if the end entity was not found.
        CouldNotRemoveEndEntityException - if the user could not be deleted.

      • revokeUser

        void revokeUser​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                String username,
                int reason)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                NoSuchEndEntityException,
                ApprovalException,
                WaitingForApprovalException,
                AlreadyRevokedException
        Method that revokes a user. Revokes all users certificates and then sets user status to revoked. If user status is already revoked it still revokes all users certificates, ignoring the ones that are already revoked.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        username - the username to revoke.
        reason - revocation reason to use in certificate revocations
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        NoSuchEndEntityException - fail
        AlreadyRevokedException - if user is revoked and unrevocation is attempted by sending revocation reason NOTREVOKED or REMOVEFROMCRL
        ApprovalException - if revocation has been requested and is waiting for approval.
        WaitingForApprovalException - fail

      • revokeUser

        void revokeUser​(AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                String username,
                int reason,
                boolean deleteUser)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                CADoesntExistsException,
                ApprovalException,
                WaitingForApprovalException,
                AlreadyRevokedException,
                NoSuchEndEntityException,
                CouldNotRemoveEndEntityException,
                EjbcaException
        Revokes all of a user's certificates. It is also possible to delete a user after all certificates have been revoked. Authorization requirements:
         - /administrator
 - /ra_functionality/revoke_end_entity
 - /endentityprofilesrules/<end entity profile>/revoke_end_entity
 - /ca/<ca of users certificate>
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - of the requesting administrator or client.
        username - unique username in EJBCA
        reason - for revocation, one of RevokedCertInfo.REVOKATION_REASON_ constants or use RevokedCertInfo.NOT_REVOKED to un-revoke a certificate on hold.
        deleteUser - deletes the users after all the certificates have been revoked.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if client isn't authorized.
        CADoesntExistsException - if a referenced CA does not exist.
        ApprovalException - if there already exists an approval request for this task.
        WaitingForApprovalException - if request has bean added to list of tasks to be approved.
        AlreadyRevokedException - if the user already was revoked.
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if End Entity bound to certificate isn't found.
        CouldNotRemoveEndEntityException - if the user could not be deleted.
        EjbcaException - any EjbcaException.

      • revokeUserAfterApproval

        void revokeUserAfterApproval​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                             String username,
                             int reason,
                             int approvalRequestID,
                             AuthenticationToken lastApprovingAdmin)
                      throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                             NoSuchEndEntityException,
                             ApprovalException,
                             WaitingForApprovalException,
                             AlreadyRevokedException
        Method that revokes a user. Revokes all users certificates and then sets user status to revoked. If user status is already revoked it still revokes all users certificates, ignoring the ones that are already revoked. This method is called mainly when executing a RevocationApprovalRequest
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        username - the username to revoke.
        reason - revocation reason to use in certificate revocations
        approvalRequestID - the ID of the approval request submitted to revoke the user
        lastApprovingAdmin - the last administrator to have approved the request
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        NoSuchEndEntityException - fail
        AlreadyRevokedException - if user is revoked and unrevocation is attempted by sending revocation reason NOTREVOKED or REMOVEFROMCRL
        ApprovalException - if revocation has been requested and is waiting for approval.
        WaitingForApprovalException - fail

      • revokeCert

        void revokeCert​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                BigInteger certserno,
                Date revocationdate,
                String issuerdn,
                int reason,
                boolean checkPermission)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                NoSuchEndEntityException,
                ApprovalException,
                WaitingForApprovalException,
                AlreadyRevokedException,
                RevokeBackDateNotAllowedForProfileException
        Same as revokeCert(AuthenticationToken, BigInteger, String, int) but also sets the revocation date.
        Parameters:
        admin - admin
        certserno - sn
        revocationdate - after this the the certificate is not valid
        issuerdn - dn
        reason - reason
        checkPermission - if true and if 'revocationdate' is not null then the certificate profile must allow back dating otherwise a RevokeBackDateNotAllowedForProfileException is thrown.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if certificate to revoke can not be found
        ApprovalException - if revocation has been requested and is waiting for approval.
        WaitingForApprovalException - fail
        AlreadyRevokedException - fail
        RevokeBackDateNotAllowedForProfileException - fail

      • revokeCert

        void revokeCert​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                BigInteger certserno,
                String issuerdn,
                int reason)
         throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                NoSuchEndEntityException,
                ApprovalException,
                WaitingForApprovalException,
                AlreadyRevokedException
        Method that revokes a certificate for a user. It can also be used to un-revoke a certificate that has been revoked with reason ON_HOLD. This is done by giving reason RevokedCertInfo.NOT_REVOKED (or RevokedCertInfo.REVOCATION_REASON_REMOVEFROMCRL).
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        certserno - the serno of certificate to revoke.
        issuerdn - DN
        reason - the reason of revocation, one of the RevokedCertInfo.XX constants. Use RevokedCertInfo.NOT_REVOKED to re-activate a certificate on hold.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        AlreadyRevokedException - if the certificate was already revoked
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if certificate to revoke can not be found
        ApprovalException - if an approval already exists for this request.
        WaitingForApprovalException - fail
        AlreadyRevokedException - fail

      • revokeCertWithMetadata

        void revokeCertWithMetadata​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                            CertRevocationDto certRevocationDto)
                     throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                            NoSuchEndEntityException,
                            ApprovalException,
                            WaitingForApprovalException,
                            AlreadyRevokedException,
                            RevokeBackDateNotAllowedForProfileException,
                            CertificateProfileDoesNotExistException
        Method that revokes a certificate for a user. It can also be used to un-revoke a certificate that has been revoked with reason ON_HOLD. This is done by giving reason RevokedCertInfo.NOT_REVOKED (or RevokedCertInfo.REVOCATION_REASON_REMOVEFROMCRL). reason, certificateProfileId and revocationdate can be included as input parameters wrapped into CertRevocationDto dto class.
        Parameters:
        admin - token of the administrator performing the action
        certRevocationDto - wrapper object of the input parameters for the revoke.
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        AlreadyRevokedException - if the certificate was already revoked
        NoSuchEndEntityException - if certificate to revoke can not be found
        ApprovalException - if an approval already exists for this request.
        WaitingForApprovalException - fail
        AlreadyRevokedException - fail
        RevokeBackDateNotAllowedForProfileException - fail
        CertificateProfileDoesNotExistException - if no profile was found with certRevocationDto.certificateProfileId input parameter.

      • revokeCertAfterApproval

        void revokeCertAfterApproval​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                             BigInteger certserno,
                             String issuerdn,
                             int reason,
                             int approvalRequestID,
                             AuthenticationToken lastApprovingAdmin)
                      throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                             NoSuchEndEntityException,
                             ApprovalException,
                             WaitingForApprovalException,
                             AlreadyRevokedException
        Method that revokes a certificate for a user. It can also be used to un-revoke a certificate that has been revoked with reason ON_HOLD. This is done by giving reason RevokedCertInfo.NOT_REVOKED (or RevokedCertInfo.REVOCATION_REASON_REMOVEFROMCRL). This method is called mainly when executing a RevocationApprovalRequest
        Parameters:
        admin - the administrator performing the action
        certserno - the serno of certificate to revoke.
        issuerdn - DN
        reason - the reason of revocation, one of the RevokedCertInfo.XX constants. Use RevokedCertInfo.NOT_REVOKED to re-activate a certificate on hold.
        approvalRequestID - the ID of the approval request submitted to revoke the certificate
        lastApprovingAdmin - the last administrator to have approved the request
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        AlreadyRevokedException - if the certificate was already revoked
        NoSuchEndEntityException - fai;
        ApprovalException - if an approval already exists for this request.
        WaitingForApprovalException - fail
        AlreadyRevokedException - fail

      • checkIfCertificateBelongToUser

        boolean checkIfCertificateBelongToUser​(BigInteger certificatesnr,
                                       String issuerdn)
        Method that checks if a user with specified users certificate exists in database. IssuerDN/serialNumber is the unique key for a certificate.
        Parameters:
        certificatesnr - serial number of certificate
        issuerdn - issuerDN of certificate
        Returns:
        true if certificate belongs to a user, false if no user with specified certificate exists

      • existsUser

        boolean existsUser​(String username)
        Method checking if username already exists in database. WARNING: do not use this method where an authorization check is needed, use findUser there instead.
        Parameters:
        username - user
        Returns:
        true if username already exists.

      • prepareForKeyRecovery

        boolean prepareForKeyRecovery​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                              String username,
                              int endEntityProfileId,
                              Certificate certificate)
                       throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                              ApprovalException,
                              WaitingForApprovalException,
                              CADoesntExistsException
        Mark a user's certificate for key recovery and set the user status to EndEntityConstants.STATUS_KEYRECOVERY.
        Parameters:
        admin - used to authorize this action
        username - is the user to key recover a certificate for
        endEntityProfileId - ID
        certificate - is the certificate to recover the keys for. Use 'null' to recovery the certificate with latest not before date.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - fail
        ApprovalException - fail
        WaitingForApprovalException - fail
        CADoesntExistsException - fail

      • prepareForKeyRecoveryInternal

        boolean prepareForKeyRecoveryInternal​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                                      String username,
                                      int endEntityProfileId,
                                      Certificate certificate)
                               throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                      ApprovalException,
                                      CADoesntExistsException,
                                      WaitingForApprovalException
        Marks a user for key recovery and performs authorization checks. This method will not mark the certificate for key recover. Method is intended to be used when KeyRecoveryData is not present in the instance database (eg. when local key generation is enabled).
        Parameters:
        admin - used to authorize this action
        username - is the user to key recover a certificate for
        endEntityProfileId - of the end entity related to certificate
        certificate - used to check if approval is required to recover this certificate
        Returns:
        true if operation was completed successfully
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if requesting administrator isn't authorized to perform key recovery
        ApprovalException - if an approval already exists to edit user status
        CADoesntExistsException - if CA holding the user does not exist
        WaitingForApprovalException - if the request requires approval. Expected to be thorws if approval is required to edit end entity

      • findUsers

        List<EndEntityInformation> findUsers​(List<Integer> caIds,
                                     long timeModified,
                                     int status)
        Selects a list of specific list of EndEntityInformation entities, as filtered by the below parameters.
        Parameters:
        caIds - The list of CAIDs to filter by. If this list is empty, all the UserData objects that match the given expiration and status are returned.
        timeModified - Not modified since this date, as expressed by a Long value
        status - Status of the requested CAIDs
        Returns:
        list

      • renameEndEntity

        boolean renameEndEntity​(AuthenticationToken admin,
                        String currentUsername,
                        String newUsername)
                 throws AuthorizationDeniedException,
                        EndEntityExistsException
        Rename an end entity. Updates existing references in the database to this username. No re-publishing with updated username will take place.
        Parameters:
        admin - administrator that
        currentUsername - user
        newUsername - user
        Returns:
        true if an end entity with such name existed
        Throws:
        AuthorizationDeniedException - if the user was not authorized to edit this end entity
        EndEntityExistsException - the newUsername is already taken by another end entity
